website_summaries.verdict: For most people, the excellent photo quality of the Canon PowerShot SD790 IS will more than make up for any slight performance deficiencies or minor shortcomings.
cons: no optical zoom in movie mode

customer_reviews.title: Not a great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for at least 4 years now. I find that the picture quality is just not that good and it is hard to use. Pictures with a flash tend to look especially bad. There are so many functions and options that I don't know what to do with the thing half the time. I purchased it mainly because it is small and easy to carry, but since I don't enjoy taking pictures with it, I hardly want to use it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky Bingston

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I loved the first one and used it so much I wore the icons off the face. It takes fantastic pictures, near and distant, even has an excellent macro zoom. It is tiny, but awesome. Canon no longer makes this camera and I had to do some searching to find one. Canon probably makes a newer version of this, but this one did everything I want it to do and more. And I did not want to learn how to use a different one.
customer_reviews.author: SLP

customer_reviews.title: camera review
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera at least 5 years now, likely more. What have I replaced? Nothing. What has gone wrong? Not a thing. How hard was it to learn how to use - for a career photographer raised on film cameras and Nikons in specific? Not one bit.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD 790 IS
customer_reviews.text: As a user of many of Canon's cameras and camcorders, I have been very satisfied with every one I bought. This is a great camera and Canon continues to improve there lines with each new released camera. I installed a 16 gb card so I can take numerous photos and many movie clips. Anyone looking for a camera like this should have no problem with of Canon SD line of camera, The few nay sayer's in there reviews indicated a lack of understanding or they just like to complain. I highly recommend this camera
customer_reviews.author: Horace Frydman

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for 3 weeks of summer fun and photos. The battery only just ran down, so that is a big improvement over my last digital. Also, it is easy to carry the recharger on a trip. The stabilization feature proved itself when I got a good picture of the Grand Hotel on Mackinaw Island while driving over the bumpy bridge 4 miles away! The 'face-finding' feature is also neat. You don't have to center the picture on a person. I'm sure there will be lots to learn, but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Ski Race Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera since Feb. ran a fair amount of pictures though it, works great, battery life seems to be good, the screen is good enough that i don't really miss not having a view finder, and it's still small enough to fit in my pocket. I would recommend getting a screen protector if you're going to carry it in your pocket a lot, i just got one of those thin films that they make for touchscreen cell phones and cut it to the right size for the camera screen, it's been working good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Keyser Soze

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Used to have one of these years ago but screen stopped working. I loved this camera so much and was so happy when I found that you had one. I actually ended up buying 2 from this seller. Very happy with my purchase and seller had great communication and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie Marinak Sparks

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT camera and price
customer_reviews.text: Researched MANY cameras and online reviews and finally decided on the Canon Powershot SD790 IS and am so pleased. It's takes GREAT pics, is VERY easy to just point-n-shoot, yet also has lots of great features that I am sure will come in very handy. Haven't had time to read the manual yet, but that's the best thing about this camera... you can start using it immediately WITHOUT having to spend time with the manual. Love it, love it, love it... [..]
customer_reviews.author: C. GRECO

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't as happy with how this version functioned
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't as happy with how this version functioned. Items I wanted most were burried in the menus. I would encourage everyone who is buying a replacement camera (aka has ad a Canon) to first look at online manuals at Canon before buying a new one. Canon has PDFs available of all manuals I sought.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Gumball

customer_reviews.title: great pic by sd790is
customer_reviews.text: i got this camera for my wife and she's been happy with it. she's been mostly used for taking pics of our son from his age 1 to 3. it's very duable and well built. we dropped it a couple of times and nothing has been broken. this camera works great indoor, outdoor, snap shot, video, person, and background. i've been taken nearly 1 million pics and video, they r all good quality. we've been have this camera for more than 3 years and it has been served us faithfully.
customer_reviews.author: the blessed one

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithful
customer_reviews.text: It's now 2016 and I still use this camera. It's a treasure, though out dated. Great to use in rough terrain like hiking or climbing. This way if it falls into some rocks you won't feel too bad about replacing it. Very good Camera.
customer_reviews.author: eddiet

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift, although I use it , it isn't my personal camera. Canon seems to have most all the glitches in Digital photography worked out with these SD series cameras. This is the second one I have purchased this year that I have given for gifts and they seem to do a very good job . I upgraded to Extreme III 4G cards in both of them and it really helps . Canon's quality is among the top shelf cameras on the market ,so IMHO , you can't go wrong for the $$ spent. Great camera!!! Merry Christmas .
customer_reviews.author: Duc

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It was exactly what I was looking for. The 10 megapixel quality is amazing. The zoom works very nicely. I also love the different picture modes that you can use for everything from sunsets, to foliage, to indoor. The pictures come out looking beautiful. Also, the slim body of the camera makes it very portable. I highly suggest the Slim Kroo Case to go along with it as well :) I put it in that durable case, and carry it everywhere with me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pictures, portable, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It used to be that cameras this size were considered "snapshot" cameras that sacrificed on quality. Not true anymore. I am amazed at how great the pictures look for a camera this size and this price. I use it at work (in pathology) and this camera is very easy to use with just one hand. I think in the high-end range Nikon cameras are best. But I think for small point-and-shoot camerasn, Cannon can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Picture Quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best camera I have ever used. The image stabilization is awesome. It really does stabilize the shakes. The auto feature on this little camera is really good that I never had changed the mode of shooting anywhere. This camera is very good for someone who just wants to click pics on the go. The different modes in the camera make it even more attractive. I would strongly recommend this camera to anyone. Note: Buy a high speed SD card for faster shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Vasanth Kumar Padmanaban

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD790IS
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Canon Cameras but recently strayed to the Casio Exilim which I liked for the size but not for the video recording format (.mov) which was not compatible with my PS3, or easily editable with Windows Moviemaker. I decided to switch back to Canon and am very happy with this camera. Lots of options, ease of use and an excellent lens more than make up for the lack of style and smaller size of the Casio. I totaly recommend this camera for anyone looking for a point & shoot with enough options to cover most lighting conditions.(The image stabilization seems to work well, too)
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hinde

customer_reviews.title: A great camera!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera after doing some research. It seemed like the Canon Powershot was the best camera in its price range and size. We went with the 10MP Powershot camera instead of the 8MP one because the 10MP was only slightly more expensive and we figured with the rate that technology changes, we'd be outdated just that much sooner with the 8MP. So far, we've had a lot of fun figuring out the different functions and settings, and our pictures have been turning out really well.
customer_reviews.author: BoyMomx3

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought one some time ago for my wife to use. Picture quality is excellent (am running it at 6MP rather than 10). Only complaint is that videos created by this camera are very jerky in playback on anything other than the camera. However, for some reason if you copy the video file to a CD they play fine on other players.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Wow. This is the Point and Shoot to have!
customer_reviews.text: After leaving the Canon family (SD630) and trying Panasonic (DMC-TZ3) - I'm back! The SD790IS is the best Canon Point & Shoot I have tried. This is a great camera. If you would like a simple Point & Shoot with the ability to allow many manual adjustments - this is the camera to have. It's a small footprint with a lot of quality!
customer_reviews.author: S. Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. It has a very nice feature set, but that isn't the selling point. The best part of this camera is that you can just turn it on, and take amazing pictures. You don't have the to tweak anything, just point and shoot. If you want to tweak, you can, but you don't need to. I also like it since it is very small. It fits into pockets without a problem. The build quality seems great. The camera feels solid. I would recommend this product to anyone who needs a new camera without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Hamburger

customer_reviews.title: canon sd 790is
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good point and shoot camera for taking pictures of my grand daughter and after doing a lot of research I decided to buy the canon SD790IS.I must say it is everything I had hoped for and more..It takes beautiful pictures and it is very easy to use..If you want the best this is the camera..
customer_reviews.author: J. Baggett

customer_reviews.title: Hooked on Canon Digital Elphs
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this camera from the SD450 after it was dropped and refused to operate correctly. This camera is exceptionally stylish, all buttons are inlaid and cut from the body. It fits very nicely in a pocket. The picture quality is a jump from the SD450, which suffered from a focus issue. I have not taken a single out of focus picture with this camera. The response time is what you would expect from a digital camera, I don't know if there have been any advances in this area, this is purely a limitation of the flash card. If you are looking for a camera to take along with you, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Harris

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SD790IS
customer_reviews.text: Nice look and feel to this camera. Great display size. Takes wonderful pics with little effort. IS feature seems better than my Panasonic DMC-FZ7. One minor issue....wheel for adjusting scenes setting takes a fine touch to operate, esp if you have large fingers or a heavy touch. Overall a nice small camera for easy carrying and everyday photography.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Woods Jr.

customer_reviews.title: best pocket camera ever
customer_reviews.text: Our old canon SD660 was stolen in Shanghai last month by a pickpocket. We were devastated but upon return to the USA, we immediately knew we would buy another canon. We chose the SD790 because of the 3 in screen and other enhanced features. We couldn't be happier. Ironically, we were glad we were forced to buy this new camera.
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the bucks
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Canon fan for awhile so when I wanted to replace my last Canon camera, I once again only looked at Canon. I am very happy with whole camera . The photos are crisp, love the larger viewing screen, the ipodish selector is also kool as well as the modern look of the camera itself. The only reason I do not give it a 5 star is because I don't always get a blur free photo ... most of the time yes ... but I don't know if that is common on most cameras or not. Overall I a very happy with this purchase and I buy online mostly from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: A. Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Its good camera to take closer pictures in daylight
customer_reviews.text: Its good camera to take closer pictures in daylight. Low light are not that great. But very handy and battery last long. Best part is, it takes pictures with very short procesding time.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Reliable Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for about 6 months now. It is a great little camera that is small enough to go anywhere, but packs enough MP's to take poster sized pictures. I've had two previous versions of the PowerShot, one being the 750. I've purchased my 3rd one for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I went from having a sony camera (which I hated and broke within 2 months) and instead of going through the hassle to replace it, I just went back to Canon which I love and read all the reviews. This camera seemed to be the best and it definitely is. I love it!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Biggerstaff

customer_reviews.title: Still works well 3 years later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera almost three years ago. I don't use it that often, but when I need it, it always does what it is supposed to do. The menus are simple and logical enough that I don't have to take time to relearn the camera if I haven't used it recently.
customer_reviews.author: aanacki

customer_reviews.title: The last of the Canon PowerShot Steel Body Camera's
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the last of the Canon PowerShot camera's produced with a steel body. I purchased this used SD 790 on-line to replace the one I've been using for several years but eventually wore out. The "sunset" setting is great for taking sunrise and sunset shots. This pre-set feature is not included in any of the PowerShot camera's produced after this one. Very satisfied with the purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Stuckmeister

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has seen some serious abuse over the last 3 - 4 years and it still works! Sure the motor makes a little more noise when the lens comes out and goes in, but I use this when I don't want to bring my Nikon D90 around. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot 10MP camera !!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a gift but got a chance to use it. The camera takes very good pictures with a very good battery life. There is nothing more you can ask for from a camera. Perfect camera for both outdoor and indoor pictures. Really 5 star product!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and Shoot Digital
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent point and shoot digital camera. There are a lot of optional manual settings OR you can go fully automatic -- depending on your skill level and how much control you're looking for. It's a nice size to take with you just about anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad camera for the price. I had been shopping around for a long time. It takes wonderful pictures for an amateur like myself. I wanted something with a lot of megapixels so I would be "ahead" of the new technology game for at least a few months. The only problem I have is the metal outside gets fingerprints all over it easily. If you want an easy operable camera that looks good and has some bells and whistles, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier. I stick with Cannon because I've always had good results and this camera is another good one. The most important thing to me was not to have a shutter delay and this camera does well with very little delay. Takes great pictures and easy and fun to use. I'm completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra V.

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures!
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed about this camera was the quality of the pictures. They are truly great for this class of camera. As with other Canon point-and-shoots, the controls are intuitive. Overall the camera is great.
customer_reviews.author: beebop

customer_reviews.title: My Newfound Love
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to write here cause great reviews were given already but I just wanted to add my 2 cents about how wonderful this camera is. Its an upgrade for me, previously having the Sd 750. And since getting this camera, I haven't taken my fingers off it. Im just pointing and shooting at anything. And its so good 2 of my family members have bought this camera. I would highly recommend this camera, its just a great point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: K.S.Reid

customer_reviews.title: smart camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera is as good as you want it to be. Allow yourself time to learn. It's great and get's greater as you learn more. I know I will enjoy it more and more as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Vera J. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Nice CAm
customer_reviews.text: I have a sony ... this is much better ... sony turns head when you taking the picture Canon turns heads when you look at the pictures on the computer... or prints ..
customer_reviews.author: R. Kho

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera, and it well suits my needs. The only negative attribute is that it does not work at night for distance shots. The flash is too weak. You have to purchase an additional flasher that is around $100.
customer_reviews.author: H. Tant

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS
customer_reviews.text: This Canon camera is amazing. It is easy to use and takes great pictures. The camera is easy to navigate thru the options provided. I would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I had the 7.0pixel one and it died so I upgraded there are still a lot of functions I still haven't figured out perhaps the camera is smarter than me.
customer_reviews.author: Dee K.

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD790IS
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera for a recent vacation. I am a novice but was able to get terrific photos. Imagine what I'll be able to do after I read the manual!
customer_reviews.author: Ellieg

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied. This is actually the 3rd camera of this exact kind. The first swam in beer. The second, from a water bottle in a beach bag. This camera is great. Where I was really impressed was the speed of the order. I ordered it when I got home from the weekend it broke and had one before the start of the next weekend. The description was VERY accurate and I am completely satisfied. I would buy from them again. It was actually better than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Kalen

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this item as a gift and they loved it! I've used this camera before and it was easy to use without having to read the manual. Great quality pictures too!
customer_reviews.author: K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the same camera new, but this one didn't take the same quality picture. Got a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lahoud

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera since the later part of 2008, I think. I bought it to take on vacation and use it I did. I keep it on hand around the house to quick take a picture of whatever unusual is going on. Some who have reviewed it didn't like the options wheel on it. I have no problem with it. There have been many compliments on the quality of the pictures taken by this camera. I really like the software that comes with it, too. Although, I have had to buy a new computer with a different OS. There have been some problems along that line. But all in all, this is a great little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Linda F.

customer_reviews.title: outdated but great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera two years ago and it has only been good to me. While there are probably better options out there now, I love this unit!
customer_reviews.author: streamlinesurfer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I was always a Sony person and never like the look and feel of Canon. But the end result of this camera are far better then any Sony Camera I have ever used. It may not have the touch screen feature just like some new Sony Cameras but pictures taken from this camera are just awesome......
customer_reviews.author: Z. Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Tis camera is wonderful...I bought it right before a trip to cambodia. i thought that it would take awhile to learn but I used it right out of the box. the pictures are awsome. it works very well in dim and night nlight.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hanaburgh

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It has quite a few features, but mostly I love that you can simply point and shoot and you are close to guaranteed a fantastic picture. Great product, will continue to purchase Canon's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: M. James

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: Every bit of hype I read about this camera has proven to be absolutely true -- it's the best point-and-shoot camera I've ever owned, superior to even the excellent film-based Elphs. You simply can not go wrong buying this camera.
customer_reviews.author: kerbe

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Wife
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great! Highly recommend for small sized camera. We also have a Canon IS3 (more zoom). Can't go wrong with Canon.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera. Very easy to use, even for a someone who can't operate anything. The screen has a great picture, the bigger screen is definately worth it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ruder

customer_reviews.title: Classical terrific
customer_reviews.text: Great camera...bought it for my wife, she can even figure out how to take pictures. The flash seems a bit weak, but better than previous camera. Viewing screen is really nice and is bright enough to see if it is light. easy to carry, heavier that previous camera.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B. Shipley

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I had this same camera and lost it. I was so happy I found one on Amazon. I have the big Canon Rebel, which I love, but it is hard carrying it around everywhere. This Canon Powershot SD790, is amazing! The clarity of the pictures, the functions, settings etc. I feel like I learn something new about the camera everyday! I may buy an extra one just incase I ever lose this one!
customer_reviews.author: TerriC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photo's and overall excellent product with great price and 8GB memory card for $299 shipped
customer_reviews.text: Excellent photo's and overall excellent product with great price and 8GB memory card for $299 shipped
customer_reviews.author: D. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera because I dropped our last one on a concrete floor and fractured the lens. I love this camera, it's easy to use, takes great pictures, has the image stability feature which in a small camera is a must.
customer_reviews.author: G. Quattlebaum

customer_reviews.title: Functional but the color isn't true. Image doesn't match ...
customer_reviews.text: Functional but the color isn't true. Image doesn't match the natural color. There appears to be a subtle orange hue over the entire image. The image is an example of how the color is untrue. There are not two shades of beige or orange on this puppy, only one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot Sd790IS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my daughter and she loves it. I checked it against the competition and thought that it had the best specs and functionality. The LCD screen is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Green

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, i have it now for a couple of years and its still great, never fails easy to use and very relighble.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart
customer_reviews.text: disappointed in the durability. The Camera takes great pictures unfortunatly it began lossing screws and falling apart after only a few monthss of very light use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: When I recieved this product the power button was broken. That was not part of its description so I was not happy and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: stylish and clean
customer_reviews.text: the camera is very stylish, especially the button design. takes very clean pictures with the variety of settings available for almost any lighting condition.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great camera at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Got the camera for my wife for her Birthday. She wanted a small camera with a long battery life. Professional resolution wasn't necessary but wanted high quality pictures. So far the camera has been great. We like the image stabilizer and the fast "time to next picture"
customer_reviews.author: Derek R Supple

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice camera, and takes excellent pictures, BUT I found it to be difficult to use. So many settings, and all I wanted was to just take the picture! This is a better camera for someone more serious about photography.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L. Grant

customer_reviews.title: too bad they are discontinued
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, my friends were so impressed that several purchased the exact item, and they love it too. About the only place to find one now is on Ebay, and no new ones are available
customer_reviews.author: jay sears

customer_reviews.title: Tommyild
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding compact camera that fits in almost any pocket, but looks like I paid more than I should have. Check for discounts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lots of features, great value, solid, small form factor, beautiful lcd screen. Cons: May require a bit of a learning curve to get used to it. Spin wheel slightly too sensitive. Overall, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Eddy Liang

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last very long the pictures started becoming very pixalated...
customer_reviews.author: amberscroggie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera works very nicely & turns out great pictures. It's fairly easy to use & yet is powerful. I had some difficulty finding some items in the documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Ted R. Hill

customer_reviews.title: still learning to use
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the camera long enough to become thoroughly familiar with all of its features or any limitatins.
customer_reviews.author: L. Robert Webb

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD790 - awesome digital camera
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this camera to anyone who is searching for a digital camera under $200. It is simple and takes wonderful pictures. Next camera I buy will most likely be a Canon as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bhavin Shah

customer_reviews.title: Good condition
customer_reviews.text: It arrived much faster than expected (6 days to Hawaii). The scratches on the camera are acceptable. The camera is really 100 percent functional as the seller demonstrated, but one noticeable problem is that every picture it takes has a thin blue line on the left side of the image. This problem may caused by several small scratches on the lens which the seller did not mentioned. But the problem is really hard to find, so generally, acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: parallelalangus

customer_reviews.title: The powershot
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first five years, until it broke down. I guess technology only last so long. bye canon powershot. =( you were loved.
customer_reviews.author: J.Lin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Service
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived quickly and in excellent condition. I will order from this seller again if I have any future camera needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great for indoor pics
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheaper kodak...i wanted to try a camera which is better and would especially get great pics indoors...this camera works ok for indoor pics when used without flash...the problem is that both the camera and the objects have to be very still for the pic to come good, especially hard with quick shots and kids...outdoors works great but so do the cheaper ones...
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera is great. It replaced one just like it that was lost. Wrong camera was sent first, but they quickly sent out the correct one, and I then returned the incorrect one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Driver

customer_reviews.title: YESYESYES
customer_reviews.text: well i must say that this camera is the best camera i've had yet. it takes VERY clear pictures, and has many many cool features! you MUST love this camera. its BOMMBB.
customer_reviews.author: Adelaida Santos

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Pictures
customer_reviews.text: It takes really good and sharp pictures. And also I like the big and bright LCD.
customer_reviews.author: Prasanth

customer_reviews.title: canon SD790IS
customer_reviews.text: I lost my Canon 750 and replaced it with the SD790IS and I like it even more than the 750 which was a good camera.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Walter

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: i got this camera to replace one i dropped in the pool. i am very happy the camera. it takes great shots and battery lasts for ever.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love my new camera!! I took it on my trip and I was able to take so many great pictures. Very fast shipping!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Santos

customer_reviews.title: not a bad little camera
customer_reviews.text: i have used this camera for little over a monthe now and i am pretty pleased with it. the colors are bright and beautiful and has a lot of neat features on this little guy. however, some of the pictures comes out blurry. other than that great camera.
customer_reviews.author: gman

customer_reviews.title: Not the Sellers Fault
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a canon camera from this seller to replace the exact same one I had prior that was having trouble with the battery compartment door. I rec'd it promptly, sooner than expected.....seller followed up to assure I was happy. I am happy with the seller, would buy from him again but will not buy the canon powershot 790 as the new camera had the same problems! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: fiestylilsunny

customer_reviews.title: Great camera - price keeps falling!
customer_reviews.text: Do you have to have a 3 inch LCD and 10 Meg CCD with no optical viewfinder? Do you have $150? This is your camera!
customer_reviews.author: Rick E. Ruge

customer_reviews.title: Did not honestly describe product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera and it came with a fake canon battery and a lead which did not fit camera to transfer photos onto computer. Don't deal with this person. Dishonest.
customer_reviews.author: l

customer_reviews.title: I'm torn
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes great pics but the controls are so clunky, I feel like I have mittens on every time I try and adjust the settings.
customer_reviews.author: HDelta

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had a powershot for years so when my old one broke, I naturally gravitated towards this one. It's been an awful disappointment. It's so bad we just let our kids use it to play with. Grainy, color is off, and the focus is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Walker

customer_reviews.title: ok condition
customer_reviews.text: nothing to write home about- it was not is as good shape as I expected- but I guess will do the job. Definitely banged up and has some marks on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: cari weiss

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom
product_meta.description:
Chiseled edges with a subtle gleam give this PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH distinctive sculptural appeal. Just as attractive are its high-end specifications, including 10 megapixels of resolution plus Face Detection and Motion Detection Technology that delivers the ultimate in crisp, clear, amazingly detailed images. Prepare to be transfixed by the view from the camera’s 3.0-inch PureColor LCD II screen. With rich, accurate color and superb clarity, the screen is easy to view at wide angles too -- perfect for gathering a group around to see your images.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Manufacturer Description 

 Chiseled edges with a subtle gleam give this PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH distinctive sculptural appeal. Just as attractive are its high-end specifications, including 10 megapixels of resolution plus Face Detection and Motion Detection Technology that delivers the ultimate in crisp, clear, amazingly detailed images. Prepare to be transfixed by the view from the camera’s 3.0-inch PureColor LCD II screen. With rich, accurate color and superb clarity, the screen is easy to view at wide angles too -- perfect for gathering a group around to see your images. 

PowerShot SD790IS Highlights 



1x zoom/3x zoom Advanced 10-megapixel Digital ELPH with 3x optical zoom and Optical Image Stabilizer The PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH offers impressive core technologies. The 10.0-megapixel CCD gives you extraordinary flexibility in cropping and enlarging: the detail and resolution are so fine that you can take any part of an image and enlarge it with confidence. The 3x optical zoom can more than handle your everyday shooting. Canon’s exclusive Optical Image Stabilizer automatically detects and cancels camera shake, ensuring that your images are crisp and blur-free throughout the zoom range. 

Motion Detection Technology automatically detects subject movement and optimizes exposure control to reduce blur Life doesn’t stand still for picture-taking. That’s why Canon included its advanced Motion Detection Technology in the PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH. This sophisticated feature works in the background to instantly evaluate how fast your subject is moving. Then it automatically selects and sets the optimal exposure and ISO settings to keep everything looking sharp and clear. When you need higher ISOs for action-stopping shutter speeds, Motion Detection Technology provides it. But when no movement is detected, it allows lower ISOs for excellent color and detail. So whether you’re shooting a bride walking down the aisle, a ballet recital or even a child’s soccer game, you can relax and shoot with confidence knowing you’ve got the picture you intended. 

Large 3.0-inch PureColor LCD II screen for bright, accurate color and wide viewing angle The PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH gives you large 3.0-inch LCD screen for excellent control when framing your shots. Canon’s PureColor LCD II offers more spectacular color, resolution and contrast even when viewed at an angle (compared to PureColor LCD). The screen is highly durable and easy to see in any light with a scratch-resistant, anti-reflective coating. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light -- a perfect feature for gathering friends and family around to see your images. 

With Canon's Face Detection WB (right), skin tones are not affected by overall lighting Improved Face Detection Technology sets the focus, exposure, flash and white balance automatically Canon's powerful Face Detection Technology delivers even better results with the new SD790 IS Digital ELPH. The Face Detection Technology continues to recognize faces in a scene, concentrate exposure (daylight or flash) and focus upon them. But the SD790 IS Digital ELPH adds more: Face Detection WB means the camera concentrates upon faces when calculating white balance for the best possible skin tones. Face Select and Track lets the SD790 IS Digital ELPH user highlight one face among several in a scene, and the camera concentrates on that person, even as they move around the scene. Face Detection Technology is a powerful contributing factor in Canon's new Motion Detection Technology. 

And with 19 Shooting Modes including 12 Special Scene Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

Edgy, stylish design combined with a cool new button configuration for great operability It’s all about edge with the PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH. Sculptured angles not only ratchet up this Digital ELPH’s "look at me" quotient, but add an extra degree of control for superior handling. Gleaming cut surfaces emphasize the camera’s slim style. A cutting-edge control dial makes accessing functions and operations easier than ever. Large, flat buttons in an intuitive configuration are uniquely attractive and fun to use. 

DIGIC III Image Processor for superior image quality and improved functionality With DIGIC III, your images boast superior quality, the camera operates at top efficiency and battery life is enhanced. What’s more, DIGIC III enables Canon’s Face Detection Technology and Red-eye Correction to give you better, more true-to-life people shots. Simply press the Shutter Button halfway down, and the camera automatically pinpoints the faces in the scene and chooses the ideal focus point. The camera controls exposure settings and flash to keep every face looking bright and natural. Red-eye Correction can be handled in-camera, in two ways. The entirely new Red-eye Correction during shooting uses the Face Detection Technology to recognize and remove red-eye from flash images as they're taken, before the file is written to the memory card. It's also possible to correct red-eye during image playback, using simple settings in the SD790 IS Digital ELPH's menu. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the fast DIGIC III Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures. 
1) The new Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken. 
2) The SD790 IS Digital ELPH can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback.
3) The user can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

The PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH also features ISO 1600 and High ISO Auto settings that reduce the effects of camera shake and sharpen subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. 

Print/Share Button for easy direct printing and downloading The PowerShot SD790 IS Digital ELPH's Print/Share button makes direct printing easier than ever. Simply connect the SD790 IS Digital ELPH to a Canon PIXMA photo printer or SELPHY compact photo printer or any PictBridge compatible photo printer, press the lighted Print/Share button and print! Also use the Print/Share button to transfer images to a computer (Windows and Macintosh). 

Print your own ID photos in up to 28 different sizes or use the Movie Print function to output multiple stills from a recorded movie on a single sheet with a Canon SELPHY compact photo printer.
feature_bullets: 10-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
Face Detection; Motion Detection Technology automatically reduces blur
3.0-inch PureColor LCD II screen for bright, accurate color and wide viewing angle
Captures images to SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus memory cards (not included)
